title: How to Restore Last Session on Google Chrome on PC or Mac

steps.title: Open Google Chrome on your computer.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on your computer. The Chrome icon looks like a multicolored ball with a blue dot at the center. You can find it in your Applications folder on a Mac and your Start menu on Windows.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . You can find this in the top-right corner of the window. It will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Hover over "History".
steps.content: Hover over "History". A side menu will open. [1] X Research source Under Recently closed , you should see [#] tabs . This indicates the number of closed tabs from your last closed session.

steps.title: Hover over "[#] tabs".
steps.content: Hover over "[#] tabs". A side menu will open with a list of your recently closed tabs.

steps.title: Click Restore window.
steps.content: Click Restore window . This is at the top of the menu. The full window will be restored with all listed tabs. If you'd rather open a single tab, click the individual page listed below Restore window to open it. [2] X Research source Alternatively, you can use the keyboard shortcut : CTRL + Shift + T (Windows) or CMD + Shift + T (Mac) to restore all recently closed tabs quickly. [3] X Research source If this doesn't restore the tabs you need, you can always check your browser history to open it manually.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome on your computer.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on your computer. The Chrome icon looks like a multicolored ball with a blue dot at the center. You can find it in your Applications folder on a Mac, and your Start menu on Windows. Google Chrome has a feature that allows you to keep your tabs after the browser window is closed . When Chrome is opened again, the tabs from your previous session will be restored.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . You can find this in the top-right corner of the window. It will open a drop-down menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Click Settings on the menu. This will open your browser settings in a new tab. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click On startup.
steps.content: Click On startup . This tab is in the left panel, underneath Default browser . This will allow you to change your browser's startup behavior. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select Continue where you left off.
steps.content: Select Continue where you left off . When this option is selected, your browser will restore and load all of your recent tabs from your last session whenever you start it up again. [7] X Research source If there's a webpage that you constantly visit, consider adding it as a bookmark for easier access.
